meanings.definition: A place of extreme filth or degradation.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned building was a disgusting hellhole filled with trash and rats.
meanings.sent2: The prison cell was a dark and dirty hellhole that no one wanted to be in.
meanings.sent3: The party venue turned into a hellhole after everyone started throwing garbage everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The old factory had become a hellhole of decay and neglect over the years.
meanings.sent5: The alley behind the restaurant was a revolting hellhole of waste and grime.

meanings.definition: A place of extreme discomfort or suffering.
meanings.sent1: The crowded bus during rush hour felt like a sweaty hellhole with no air.
meanings.sent2: The waiting room at the dentist's office was a nerve-wracking hellhole of anxiety.
meanings.sent3: Trying to assemble the furniture without instructions turned into a frustrating hellhole.
meanings.sent4: The long line at the amusement park was a never-ending hellhole of impatience.
meanings.sent5: The broken air conditioner turned the bedroom into a stifling hellhole of heat.
